place.name: EBONY
place.gazetteerText: EBONY, a parish in Tenterden district, Kent; 3 miles W of Appledore r. station, and 3¾ SE of Tenterden. Post town, Appledore, under Staplehurst. Acres, 2, 209. Real property, £4, 660. Pop., 184. Houses, 34. The property is divided among a few. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Appledore, in the diocese of Canterbury. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
